attributes.action: 2017 to be the year that the UK start protecting native wildlife In our cities.
attributes.background: Our wildlife is losing it's natural habitat & struggling to adjust to our cities.In this unknown future in the UK due to Brexit.I ask you to firstly pledge your assurance to keep EU laws on our enviroment.Secondly, a guarantee that the goverment will help make our cities accessible to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: This is important for our wildlife in the UK.In Milan over 800 trees have been planted on rooftops & balconies resulting in species abundance growth.This could be achieved in the UK with help from university students of Enviromental sciences.This cuts costs &helps students develop skills& portfolios,which could lead to job growth.If achieved,this could attract tourists to cities throughout the UK& boost our economy.There is no doubt that our wildlife,worldwide is depleting at a dangerous rate.

attributes.action: When referring to our Debt state what we owe not what % it is of something else.
attributes.background: Since 1947 our Debt increased from £25 bn to £1,547 bn but when compared to GDP it allows Gov to conceal from us their out of control spending and borrowing of more than £2 bn every week for 10 years. For more alarming facts about the way Gov run our Country see www.mrms.uk
attributes.additional_details: A debt is “a sum of money owed” and should be referred to as such. There is no logical reason why Government should compare our National Debt to GDP (or anything else) other than to keep the truth from us of their out of control spending and borrowing.

attributes.action: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes
attributes.background: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes

attributes.action: The UK should follow Sweden, cut VAT for fixing goods rather than throwing away.
attributes.background: To combat its ‘throwaway consumer culture’, Sweden has announced tax breaks on repairs to clothes, bicycles, fridges and washing machines. Repairs are more labour-intense than production, which is largely automised, repairs actually contribute to an expanding labour market decreasing unemployment.
attributes.additional_details:
Jobs would be in the U.K. not abroad, they would be where you live & benefit the local economy.  Whereas large-scale manufacturing is very centralised. This will expand the number of companies giving these kinds of services so It’ll be easier for consumers to have things repaired.

It will be easier for people to buy high-quality products because they know it’s affordable to have them fixed if something breaks, giving an  incentive not to buy as cheap as possible and then scrap something.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to breed dogs without being a registered breeder
attributes.background: It should be illegal to breed dogs unless you are a breeder registered on some sort of national register in order to stop people breeding dogs for the wrong reasons and purely for financial gain. It would also help prevent the horrific treatment and breeding in these 'puppy farms'
attributes.additional_details: A national register of breeders should be produced with them all being regulated my a body of animal welfare officers. Anyone breeding outside of these registers should be prosecuted and liable to an unlimited fine.

attributes.action: Increase the mental health budget now.
attributes.background: It's a serious issue and affects people’s physical health and the economy. Better prevention measures – access to therapies and support, faster referrals, more time to discuss with a GP versed in mental health – means better outcomes overall. We value mental health and the budget must reflect it!
attributes.additional_details: December 2016: Less and less being spent on mental health: Local authorities use less than 1% of their budget on services

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to at least 3.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: The number of combat ships in service is woefully low. This isn't acceptable for an island nation. We should have a steady return to 1985 levels , otherwise risk getting caught short , like nearly happened with the Falklands conflict.

attributes.action: Freedom of movement for non-EU students during term time if no lectures missed
attributes.background: Overseas university students holding a Tiers 4 visa are technically not allowed to leave UK during term time even if they have no running modules, or they will take own risk at UK border. The university's authorised absence letter will never be approved except for emergency reason.

attributes.action: Prioritise implementation of the alternative student finance product
attributes.background: Many Muslims are unable to attend university, because their faith prohibits them from taking interest based loans to fund tuition fees.The government has acknowledged this and have developed an alternative financing model.This needs to be made available so that more students can attend university
attributes.additional_details:
Links to previous developments;

2014 consultation
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/349899/bis-14-984-government-response-to-a-consultation-on-a-sharia-compliant-alternative-finance-product.pdf

White Paper 2016
Page 56- Alternative student finance offer
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/523546/bis-16-265-success-as-a-knowledge-economy-web.pdf

For information on developments visit
http://www.halalstudentloans.co.uk/

attributes.action: Make living wage the same for everyone.
attributes.background:
The living wage should be the same for everyone, no matter the age, gender, race or anything else!

With bill prices rising and many younger individuals having their own houses & cars it's impossible to keep out of debt. 

If your doing the same job, role & hours you should get the same wage

attributes.action: Change the law so neighbours can't play loud music at anytime not just after 11
attributes.background: In todays world people don't just work 9 till 5 and require sleep at various hrs of the day. Police have no powers to intervene before 11pm or after 7am. People have been forced to move and made ill from being forced to put up with music played unacceptably loud within flats.

attributes.action: Ban all-metal manhole covers on roads
attributes.background: Having ridden motorcycles for a number or years, I have had many encounters with slippery manhole covers on roads, especially while cornering.  The change in surface grip leads to the wheels of the vehicle slipping, potentially causing serious consequences.
attributes.additional_details: There are two practical solutions; either replace the manhole covers with a non-metallic material or coating existing covers with a higher grip material.

attributes.action: A U.K. Sovereign Wealth Fund for the long term finance of Old Age  Pensions.
attributes.background: Norway's Sovereign Wealth fund is the worlds largest, with over $700bn in assets - this equates to about £130,000 for each Norwegian citizen. Singapore also provides another example that the UK could emulate. Primary function of said fund is to finance Pensions for an increasingly aging population.
attributes.additional_details: North Sea Oil reserves are dwindling but still generate sizeable revenue for the UK Government.  This should be directly invested via a National Wealth Fund with the long term view of funding all pensions. A generous slice of all fuel duty receipt's should also be invested in said fund! As we explore Fracking, NOW is  the time to plan ahead for how revenues will be used! Looking at countries like Norway, Singapore and Qatar, A Sovereign Wealth Fund is long overdue for a country as rich as the UK.

attributes.action: Protect the NE-Derbyshire parliamentry constituency from boundary changes.
attributes.background: There has been proposed boundary changes around the UK, one including my local constituency 'North East Derbyshire', it's been proposed that the constituency be scrapped but replaced with two new ones, which obviously doesn't make sense and is completely unnecessary.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed boundary changes are in a sense 'undemocratic', local residents vote for a candidate to represent their constituency as their local MP, but changes are confusing local residents and angering some.

My source for this information is local media and other sources, I recommend googling about it, to find more information to prove this.

attributes.action: HM Forces exempt Higher rate Stamp Duty on additional residential properties
attributes.background: The MOD have changed service personnels pensions, pay and allowances persistently for the worst over the last decade. To supplement their heavily reduced pensions on retirement service personnel in the past have built up property portfolios, the Government have now made this practically impossible
attributes.additional_details: In the Autumn Statement on 25 November 2015, the Chancellor of the Exchequer announced that higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax would apply from 1 April 2016 to purchases of additional residential properties, such as second homes and buy-to-let properties. With the Armed Forces numbers shrinking on a daily basis and recruitment drives failing this would be a big incentive for serving personnel to provide a return of service for exemption from Higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT).

attributes.action: STOP funding the White Helmets & stop accepting funding from Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lGq6aLTOF_I
http://www.islamicsupremecouncil.org/understanding-islam/anti-extremism/7-islamic-radicalism-its-wahhabi-roots-and-current-representation.html
attributes.additional_details: This video from the UN Peace Council clearly states what is happening in Syria and talks about the White Helmets & Saudi Arabia. The White Helmets claim they are neutral yet they have been filmed carrying guns & participating in terrorist videos of beheading. Saudi Arabia funding is introducing a radical form of Islam, Wahabism into our education system.

attributes.action: Make Guildford town a city
attributes.background: Guildford is the county town of Surrey and  a bid in was rejected in 2002. It is time to make a change.
attributes.additional_details: Since the bid was rejected it has progressed into a thriving town with at top 5 university status. A busy town centre with top designer shop. A category 1 station with good schools both public and private. Most people think Guildford is a city already as it has had a cathedral for many years now.

attributes.action: Make Ear piercing for under 12's illegal
attributes.background:
Ear piercing babies or young children is distressing and painful for the child.
There is a risk of infection or damage to the ears.
It should be the persons choice to have holes put in their ears, therefore a age limit should be put into practise.

attributes.action: Do not criminalise parents for failing to get their children to school on time.
attributes.background:
We all know how unreliable public transport is and things go wrong on the roads, slowing down traffic.

Charging poor / low income parents £60 for not getting a child to school on time will ruin a lot of families and give them a criminal record.

Are they going to criminalise bus companies too?
attributes.additional_details: Of course the UK want to show the world that we are serious about education, but let the evolutionary breakthroughs that are pooring out of our top universities be a testament to that... Don't criminalise good, law abiding, hard working people - It's completely bonkers!

attributes.action: Give uk residents a 3 day weekend once a month for a day of leisure.
attributes.background: As a relief from the stresses of modern day living, uk residents should be given a 3 day weekend once a month or every 2 months. People in this country work more hours than the whole of europe so should be given half days pay for the extra day off.

attributes.action: No referendum for Scottish independence until at least 2 years after Brexit
attributes.background:
The Scottish Parliament wishes to have another Scottish Referendum again due to the UK voting to leave the EU .
We call on the UK Government to not accept this request until 2021 so that Scottish voters have a clear view of what Brexit is like
This will also stop politicians using project fear.

attributes.action: Place NHS in a trust along the lines of BBC.
attributes.background: NHS has gone through too many changes following political dogma depending on which party or minister is in charge.  NHS requires steady management on long term basis so it can concentrate on long term public heath and needs.  It needs to be taken out of the political arena
attributes.additional_details: Billions wasted on restructuring NHS over the years, staff demoralised, too much bureaucracy with millions wasted on duplicated work in trust hospitals and we never know what the real agenda of the government in power has for its long-term future.  Individual trust hospitals do not work and a national strategy managing ALL aspects of health is required.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement food establishments provide nutritional information
attributes.background:
My son has type 1 Diabetes and is dependent on Insulin injections for food. 
The amount of insulin he needs depends on how many Carbohydrates he is having per meal. 
Nutritional information should be available in food establishments so that diabetics can accurately carb count.
attributes.additional_details: In order to prevent life threatening  Hypoglycemia and Hyperglycemia results in Type 1 Diabetic patients make it a legal requirement that food establishments provide nutritional information on all food that they serve.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for companies to have a mental illness aware course
attributes.background: I think alot of people are unaware of mental illness' because it can not be seen. Most people dont understand the basic facts on mental health issues. Different situations in a work place can effect people suffering with mental illness' . This will offer support.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe everyone should know how it effects people on a daily basis. 1 in 6.8 people experience mental health problems in the workplace.
It is estimated that 1 in 6 people in the past week experienced a common mental health problem. Diagnosed or undiagnosed it is a major issue that needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Full pay leave for a minimum of 4 weeks for pregnancy loss prior to 24 weeks
attributes.background:
Currently pregnant women are forced to take statutory or company sick pay for pregnancy loss prior to 24 weeks gestation.
My little girl was still born at 23 weeks, which meant I had none of the same rights as I would had she of been born 1 week later, women are not given adequate time after loss
attributes.additional_details: I am requesting a change in legislation for loss of pregnancy prior to 24 weeks, so that women are able to heal physically & mentally with out financial hardship. This should be for an absolute minimum of 4 weeks and should be treated completely differently to normal sick pay.

attributes.action: Make Asthma Medication Available over the Counter at a Pharmacy
attributes.background: Being Asthmatic, its hard to judge when your medication will run out as some days you need more medication than others. If you run out you have to wait 48 hours form your GP to get a new prescription or please with a pharmacist to loan you one or sell you one. Asthmatics need direct access to meds.
attributes.additional_details: If you run out GP is closed and a pharmacist wont sell you one, you have two options, go to a walk in centre where they can treat you if you are having an attack, but not supply you with meds. Or you can go to hospital, where you will be warded, nebulised, be given a full examination and chest x ray and then be prescribed an inhaler. Making asthma medication available will save money for the NHS and let people breathe when they need to. Chemists will sell you Viagra but not an inhaler!

attributes.action: 65 and over to retake driving test or top up test
attributes.background:
The driving test now is near impossible.  Most failing at least once. 50 years ago the test was a completely different story, no theory test and nowhere near as strict. 
As well as a lack of road knowledge, unfortunately their age has a side effect on other road users causing traffic and accidents.

attributes.action: Abolish the Life Peerages Act and return Hereditary Peers to the House of Lords
attributes.background: The Upper House has become perilously close to having the British public demand its abolition and replaced with an American style senate. The only way to prevent this is to stop using it as something with which to reward the party faithful and wealthy donors. Return to the way it worked for 300 yrs

attributes.action: Prevent the return, to Britain, of British citizens that went to fight for Isis.
attributes.background: With the imminent defeat of Isis, particularly in Iraq, it would put the security of the UK at further risk if the people who went to Iraq to fight for Isis to be allowed to return to live in the U.K.

attributes.action: Let council tenants rent to buy - Pay rent but own your home at the end of it
attributes.background: Help all people get on the property ladder and own their own rent-to-buy council tenants after one year of living in any council property

attributes.action: Council tax banding needs updating
attributes.background: Council tax banding needs to reflect the current market. Many houses are worth more than a million and yet the banding has not been updated.
attributes.additional_details: With councils in debts as it is, higher valued properties I.e. 1 million, 2 million etc need additional banding beyond H. Please add more bands to pay for social care etc.

attributes.action: Tighten rules on companies that charge under 18s as if they were adult
attributes.background: It is unfair that we are not legally classed as an adult, so cannot vote, buy alcohol, be paid the adult minimum wage etc.. , but are expected to pay higher prices as if we were an adult , such as on buses, at cinemas, theme parks, airlines etc

attributes.action: Pensions for nurses Who have worked forty years and are over sixty
attributes.background:
Nurses over sixty are struggling to work in physically exhausting jobs.
We nursed in the seventies lifting heavy patients without hoists.
We used the Austrailian lift where we literally lifted the patient on our backs.
Long term hard physical and emotional nursing takes its toll.
attributes.additional_details:
Most of my friends are nurses, none of them have been able to keep going.
Let us have our state pension that we worked so hard for.
 I didn't expect to be in this position after forty five years of hard physical work I need dignity in retirement.

attributes.action: Scrap Stamp Duty
attributes.background:
Stamp duty makes it very difficult to buy a first home or even move home. 
The govement have schemes to help people get on the property ladder but then tax you if you do actually buy a home.

attributes.action: Do not bring 3,000 refugee children into the UK.
attributes.background: These children are currently in a safe country, their needs should be met by that country.  It sends out the wrong message and encourages unscrupulous economic migrants/refugees to send unaccompanied and vulnerable children to Europe so they can follow after them.

attributes.action: A referendum to stop HS2 & spend the money on more appropriate things.
attributes.background: The previous Labour Gov't and subsequent administrations are grandstanding to create a new railway, which will make the journey between London and Birmingham 20 minutes shorter. This will destroy so many pretty villages and people's homes & at present is estimated to cost between £50 & £80 billion.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the 19th century where our Victorian forbears really were innovative and had great reasons to build. They were investing in the great Industrial revolution for it to work then and there. The HS2 project will come to "fruition" in 30 years time and by that time, it is very possible it will be out of date. Businessmen can work on trains and often this journey is beneficial to a meeting. Cutting the journey time by 20 minutes is a false economy, whilst so many other projects need funds.

attributes.action: Make fake news reporting by the media a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Fake news stories should never make it to broadcast status or be publicised.
All corporate media outlets whether broadcast news or printed should have to verify, validate and publicise their sources for reports or face criminal charges and heavy financial penalties for disseminating fake news.
attributes.additional_details:
Fake news is a scourge and has been for some considerable time.
It creates distrust of information that is supposed to inform the public.
News media outlets are no longer reliable sources of unbiased news, they are in fact attempting to make news and drive public opinion politically in directions favourable to their owners own views.
The aim of the media is apparently to hold governments and others to account, yet no one is holding the media to account for faking news reports.

attributes.action: All new members of the House of Lords should sit for 10 years
attributes.background:
The present House of Lords has been a mockery for many many years.viz Iolanthe written in the 1800s. Major reform is unlikely. However my minor change would, in due time, reduce the numbers.
It should not be difficult to make this change.

attributes.action: New generation social housing policy
attributes.background: It is an issue close to many of our hearts that too many people are without affordable and safe accommodation. That as a country we are not doing enough to provide affordable housing, specialist housing units for under 25's, mother and baby units for our future generations.
attributes.additional_details:
We are campaigning for a new policy dictating:-

- Housing to be provided only to those with 10+ years in the UK
- New Decent Homes Standards
- Rent assessed on affordability with a baseline on each property
- Annual property reviews including tenancy and accommodation
- New Tenancy Groups which deal with localised property repair issues
- More specialised properties including low rent properties, young peoples living, over 50's & mother and baby units
- New Housing Officer Role & Training

attributes.action: Put legalizing medical cannabis to a referendum/ballot
attributes.background: If the prime minister is willing to quit the common market because of the will of the people then should medical cannabis for the sick be put to a Referendum/ballot to determine the will of the people? And act on it now!

attributes.action: UK Armed Police to be paid slightly more than normal police officers. Danger Pay
attributes.background:
UK Armed Police are ranked and paid like normal police officers however, im sure we can all agree the two jobs are very different.

Granted they volunteer for the role however, carrying firearms and being responsible for being the first in to terrorist threats to protect the public is different.
attributes.additional_details:
They should be paid slightly more.

Im not saying pop star wage, or even a considerable amount. Im talking a couple hundred pounds extra a month as lets say, danger pay and risk over reward pay. Give them that extra satisfaction that its worth the risk. Not everyone could do their job, it requires a different human being, so pay them that difference.

attributes.action: Article 50 bill to include an executive confirmation referendum on 30/3/2017.
attributes.background: The article 50 act needs to be passed, but should include a 2nd referendum on 30/3/ 17 askng the UK public to confirm their  wish to leave the EU, in light of a very different world outlook. Peers and MPs would be supporting the democracy of the UK, giving the people a final but now informed choice
attributes.additional_details: The politics of the world are very different than 23 June 2016, when Trump and the option of hard Brexit was not a consideration. Much of the argument on both sides has proven to be false. Any reasonable individual would think it only right and proper to reflect and review a decision made in their personal life if circumstances changed. It is only right the UK population is allowed to do the same. A 2nd leave vote would however also give the UK govt a full and informed mandate from the people.

attributes.action: Use our "special relationship" to persuade Trump to release his tax returns now.
attributes.background: The ordinary man has to pay tax, and has no choice in the matter. President Trump, as the leader of the free world, should set the example. He has claimed he paid millions in taxes, but has never proved it - Now he is president he should release his tax returns to back up his claims.

attributes.action: Make Holocaust denial illegal in the UK
attributes.background: In a number of European countries Holocaust denial is an illegal practice including Germany, Austria, Belgium and France. To deny the Holocaust is to deny the suffering of millions and minimise the gross wrongs done against Jewish, disabled, homosexual and non-white people in the 1930s/40s.
attributes.additional_details: In Germany the law states: "(3) Whosoever publicly or in a meeting approves of, denies or downplays an act committed under the rule of National Socialism of the kind indicated in section 6 (1) of the Code of International Criminal Law, in a manner capable of disturbing the public peace shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding five years or a fine." This is the type of ruling I believe should be put in place in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for DVLA to disclose drivers' details to private companies.
attributes.background: DVLA should not be allowed to give out drivers names and addresses to any person or company unless a serious offence has been committed. It should be made an offence to do so.

attributes.action: Declare the Tube an essential service and force unions into compulsory mediation
attributes.background: Tube strikes have been paralyzing London for years for all kinds of reasons. The battle between the unions and TfL management leave the public in the lurch, suffering through queues and bringing roads to a standstill. They do great damage to economy, emergency services and environment.
attributes.additional_details: Compulsory mediation would force both parties to the negotiating table and to achieve a fair outcome through mediation by an independent third party. Strikes are avoided and the public is not harmed by abstract, arcane industrial disputes.

attributes.action: Stop penalising ex Veterens on their war pensions.
attributes.background: I want the government to stop penalising ex veterans who claim a war pension, but have to surrender most of it because they are out of work and claim benefits.

attributes.action: Stop local councils cutting low paid jobs without first cutting top salaries.
attributes.background: Recently, Newcastle City Council approved an £8500 pay rise for its chief executive despite assurances to the contrary. Many local council chief executives earn more than the Prime Minister and yet jobs lower down the pay scale are cut to save money.
attributes.additional_details: Dan O'Donaghue's article for the chronicle drew this issue to my attention. 30/1/17

attributes.action: Ban petitions calling for a ban on visits by heads of state invited by UK Govt
attributes.background: The media is full of 'news' on petitions calling for heads of states which have been invited by the UK Government to visit to be banned from visiting. This is a waste of resources and time, obviously the UK Govt has deemed it right that these people are invited in the first place.

attributes.action: Tax footy transfers >£1m to fund NHS nurses & require firms to sponsor a nurse
attributes.background: All football transfer to be taxed at vat rate go towards NHS nurses funding in whole of uk. Any firm over a set size would be required to fund a nurses salary and uniform - any additional nurse funding by the same firm could be in part allowable against tax.
